quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Usa and Conservatives
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, structure, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What conical tent is constructed by Native Americans, using buffalo hide?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tipi

questions.question: Name the portable dwelling structure used by nomads during their constant travels in Central Asia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yurt

questions.question: In the USA, Conservatives favor school vouchers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What kind of lodging, traditionally constructed in the northern hemisphere, is sometimes called a snow house?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Igloo

questions.question: The origin of this hotel dates back to the early twentieth century, when the first hotels along highways became popular.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Motel

questions.question: Which term refers to a small, usually sometimes ruined building in the middle of the woods?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shack

questions.question: What style of hotel accommodation, developed in Japan by Kurokawa Kisho, features modular plastic quarters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Capsule hotel

questions.question: What is the name of an English shelter, usually free for use by anyone, found in remote mountain areas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bothy

questions.question: Which dome-like Native American tent is made by the semi-nomadic tribes of the American West and Southwest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wickiup

questions.question: Conservatives in the USA believe that local problems, which are common to all states, should be solved at the national level.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Liberals are likely to spend more money on the military than Conservatives.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the USA, Liberals favor welfare initiatives, such as aid to families with dependent children.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This is a traditional Japanese inn dating back to the 17th century, nowadays often situated along highways.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ryokan

questions.question: Conservatives in the USA are more likely to pass a law cutting taxes to the wealthy than Liberals.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Liberals in the USA are more likely to spend money on education than Conservatives.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Origin and Company
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, stars, buckingham. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What type of house was built using raw logs, particularly in the early years of United States and Canada?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Log cabin

questions.question: Which Far East company name can be translated as three stars?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Samsung

questions.question: Lufthansa is a German air carrier. What is the meaning of the name?

options.text: It used to be named Luftwaffe, but after the WW II it was changed to erase war associations.
The founders were Gustav LUFTig and HANS von Junkers.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Luft = air; Hanse = guild (or union.)

questions.question: IBM is a computer hardware and software giant. What does its name stand for?

options.text: Informatio Bene Mentis (Latin, loosly: (new) concepts are good for the intellect)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: International Business Machines

questions.question: Buckingham Palace, the official home of the Queen of England, was built in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1703

questions.question: Iona is a small island from which Christianity was spread to Scotland and northern England. The island gave name to a company. What does Iona make?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Integration software

questions.question: You probably have heard of software and hardware. Can you tell what Compuware makes?

options.text: Software that ease the life of IT managers and practitioners

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Software that ease the life of IT managers and practitioners

questions.question: What is the origin of the name FIAT?

options.text: Abbreviation of Fabbrica Italiana Automobili Torino
Fiat in Latin means let it be.
Trattieni il fiato means to hold your breath in Italian - a reference to the beauty of the first model.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abbreviation of Fabbrica Italiana Automobili Torino

questions.question: McDonalds is named after its founders. Burger King is self-explanatory. Do you know what KFC stands for?

options.text: Kansas, Fort Cheenook (the place where it was established)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kentucky Fried Chicken

questions.question: Google is not just a search engine. It is a multinational company. What is the origin of the name?

options.text: To google means to do research, to obtain information.
Goo glen is a suburb of Palo Alto, where the company is located.
Gogol is village in Russia, where one of the founders was born.
Its a misspelling of googol - a number written as 1 followed by one-hundred zeros.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Its a misspelling of googol - a number written as 1 followed by one-hundred zeros.

questions.question: Nokia is widely known for their mobile phones. What does Nokia mean?

options.text: The first mobile phones were made by Kia, so NoKia was meant to hurt the market pioneer.
It doesnt have any meaning, just sounds good.
Its a name of a town in Finland where the company used to have HQ.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Its a name of a town in Finland where the company used to have HQ.

questions.question: What is the origin of the name 3M, the company that makes almost everything?

options.text: McGonagle, McKnight, McNemey were the founders
Me and My Mom (the company was established bu a mother and son duo)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing

questions.question: While surfing the Internet you may be using Cisco networking equipment without even knowing it. But do you know the origin of the name Cisco?

options.text: The founders where from Colorado, Indiana, South Carolina and Oregon
It was named for San FranCISCO
The founders were named Alain CISse and Erwin COfalka
It stands for Communication and Information Systems COrporation

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was named for San FranCISCO

questions.question: The British Airways London Eye, which opened in 1999, is what type of structure?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An observation wheel

questions.question: AXA is a French insurance group. What does the name mean?

options.text: Nothing! It was chosen deliberately as AXA is not a word in any known language and is easy to pronounce.
Axa was a Belgian comic book hero who had many accidents, but always came out safe.
Antoine Xavier Ancienne was the founder.
It comes from Latin word laxo, meaning to liberate or to relieve.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nothing! It was chosen deliberately as AXA is not a word in any known language and is easy to pronounce.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: London and State
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, structure, hill. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This 183-meter skyscraper in London was originally built  for the National Westminster Bank.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tower 42

questions.question: This amazing single-roofed structure, located on the Greenwich peninsula in south-east London, was engineered by Buro Happold.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Millennium Dome

questions.question: In which state was the first sales tax enacted?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: West Virginia

questions.question: Which was the 14th state admitted to the Union?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vermont

questions.question: In which city were Malcolm X., Warren Buffett, Marlon Brando, and Gerald Ford born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Omaha, Nebraska

questions.question: Apart from actions related to the Civil War, which two American states declared  war on each other?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ohio and Michigan

questions.question: Which tower, located in the Palace of Westminster in London, is usually referred to as Big Ben?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Clock Tower

questions.question: This temple, discovered in Walbrook in 1957, was built in the middle of the third century in worship of a popular mystic religion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Temple of Mithras

questions.question: In 1915 the boll weevil devastated the cotton crop in this state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alabama

questions.question: Where is the National Civil Rights Museum?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In a motel

questions.question: In which state would one see the House on the Rock?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wisconsin

questions.question: This cathedral, situated on Ludgate Hill, dates back to the 17th century and is the seat of the Bishop of London.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St Pauls Cathedral

questions.question: Designed by architect Norman Foster, this building has housed some of Londons most important authorities since 2002.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: City Hall

questions.question: This London building, sometimes referred to as Covent Garden, functions as a performing arts venue.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Royal Opera House

questions.question: The design of this London monument, situated near Speakers Corner in Hyde Park, is based on the design of the triumphal arch of Constantine, located in Rome.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marble Arch

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Color and China
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Where is Greenland located?

options.text: Between the Arctic and Atlantic oceans
West of Great Britain, its a nickname of Ireland

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Between the Arctic and Atlantic oceans

questions.question: The Black Sea is almost a lake. How is it connected to other sea waters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: By Bosphorus strait

questions.question: What do these movies have in common: Me, Myself  and Irene, Miss Congeniality, World Trade Center  and Salaam Namaste?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ben and Jerrys Ice Cream

questions.question: When was Puerto Rico admitted to the Union?

options.text: It is not a US state

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is not a US state

questions.question: Which is the only American state to have no national parks, no national historical sites, no national  historic battle sites, no national historic sea shores?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Delaware

questions.question: Which US President occupied every major non-judicial elected office in the American political system?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew Johnson

questions.question: Montenegro means Black Mountain”. What is it?

options.text: An island on the Mediterranean Sea

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A country in the Balkans

questions.question: Schwarzwald is a mountain range in southern Germany. What does the name mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black Forrest

questions.question: Belarus is a country containing a color in its name. Which color is it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White

questions.question: Which of these countries has a color in its name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cape Verde

questions.question: Where is the White Sea located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North-eastern Europe

questions.question: What distinction does Bailey Brown hold?

options.text: He was the first Union soldier killed by the Confederates in the Civil War.
He was the first American killed in the War of 1812.
He was the first American killed in the Spanish-American War.
He was  he first American killed in World War I.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was the first Union soldier killed by the Confederates in the Civil War.

questions.question: Which of these seas with color names doesnt exist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue Sea

questions.question: You probably know that the Yellow River is a mighty river in China. What is its original name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Huang He

questions.question: Most people have heard about the Yellow river in China. But where is the Green River?

options.text: It is Irelands second longest river.
Its a tributary of the Colorado river.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Its a tributary of the Colorado river.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Death and Communism
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, death, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Marxist theories led to the foundation of The Russian Social Democratic Workers Party. Although there were several other social democratic parties in Europe at this time, this was the only one to maintain the principles of Communism. One branch of it was headed by Vladimir Lenin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bolsheviks

questions.question: The ideas of communism became so widely popular that by the 80s, almost a quarter of the world was under communist rule.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: According to Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels, the capitalistic system, based on personal ownership, had to be replaced by the communist society, where everything is communally owned. This was the course to overthrow capitalism, that they suggested.

options.text: It would happen inevitably and there was no reason to intervene in this natural process

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Proletarian revolution

questions.question: After the death of Stalin in 1953, Nikita Khrushchev came to power. The Cold War reached its peak under his rule, when Khrushchev ordered the installation of short and middle ranged ballistic missiles in Cuba. Although the conflict was settled peacefully, the world was under the threat of nuclear war for 38 long days. There was no winner in this crisis, because just as the Soviets had to remove their missiles from Cuba, the United States had to dismantle their missile installations in this country, which lies on two continents.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Turkey

questions.question: After the end of World War II many countries were overtaken by communist influence. Most of them were in Eastern European, but not all. Mao Zedong came to power in China and established the Peoples Republic of China in this year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1949

questions.question: After the death of Vladimir Lenin there were two possible successors. Joseph Stalin (Iosif Vissarionovich Jughashvili), who had been  general secretary of the Soviet Communist Party since 1922, was one possibility. The other one was Leon Trotsky. What happened to Trotsky after Stalin became leader of the Soviet Union?

options.text: He became general secretary of the Soviet Communist Party
He was exiled and later released
He was killed after a trial
He was exiled and later killed

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was exiled and later killed

questions.question: The second stage of The Russian Revolution led to to the creation of the Soviet Union and took place in November.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Geogry Markov, a Bulgarian dissident, is probably one of the most famous political victims of Communism in Eastern Europe. Even though he defected from Bulgaria, his life remained in danger. The Bulgarian secret police, with the help of KGB, found located and assassinated him in London using one of the strangest weapons of the Cold War; a small platinum pellet with two holes drilled in it, filled with poison, was fired in his calf muscle by an umbrella. What kind of poison was in the pellet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ricin

questions.question: Where is the Purple Mountain located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In China

questions.question: Marx and Engles were the first to openly criticise the idea of personal property.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The work of two modern philosophers, Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels, was published on 21 February 1848. It explained the principles of Communism and laid the purposes and program of the Communist League. The significance of this political treatise was so great, that Marx and Engles were expelled from Belgium when it was published. What was its name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Communist Manifesto

questions.question: The faction of the Russian Social Democratic Workers Party, led by Lenin, succeeded in overthrowing the regime of Alexander Kerensky by revolution. When did it take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1917

questions.question: One of the most famous quotes of Stalin is The death of one man is a tragedy. The death of millions is a statistic. But when it comes to the victims of his regime, is not just a statistic. Even though determining the exact number of Stalins victims is virtually impossible,  we know about millions of people, either shot or exiled to labor camps, in the years of his rule. This was the name of the administration which ran these camps.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gulag

questions.question: Fidel Castro and Ernesto Che Guevara are among the most famous revolutionaries. Che Gevara was one of Castros guerrillas in his army, the 26th of July Movement. Although this army was small in numbers and not well trained, Fidel Castro took control over Cubas government. What was the name of the leader of Cuba before Fidel Castro took control?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fulgencio Batista

questions.question: He was the communist dictator of Romania from 1965 to 1989. On 25 December 1989 he and his wife were executed by a firing squad. They were charged with various crimes, such as unjust gathering of wealth at the expense of the people and even genocide.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nicolae Ceauşescu

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Capital and City
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, leader, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which one of these volcanoes is not situated in the State of California?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: La Palma

questions.question: When was Arnold Schwarzenegger sworn into office as the 38th Governor of California?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: November 2003

questions.question: Name the capital and largest city of Fiji.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Suva

questions.question: What city, situated on the Baltic Sea coast, is the capital of Latvia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Riga

questions.question: When this great leader came to power in 1985, it marked the beginning of the end of the Soviet Union. He tried to reform the Soviet Union by introducing glasnost and perestroika. He abandoned the Brezhnev Doctrine and let the other Communist countries settle their internal affairs alone. Because he literally ended the Cold War, he was awarded a Nobel Peace Prize on 15 October 1990.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mikhail Gorbachev

questions.question: Port Moresby is the capital of Papua New Guinea.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the capital and largest city of the Republic of Maldives?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Malé

questions.question: Is the capital of Hawaii named after its founder?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: What city, located on Upolu Island, is the capital of Samoa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Apia

questions.question: Which city, founded in 1848, is the capital of the State of California, USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sacramento

questions.question: Finish the lyrics of the official state song of California, I Love You, California written by F. B. Silverwood:

options.text: You are very dear to me.
It is where I want to be.
It is home sweet home to me.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is home sweet home to me.

questions.question: What is the capital of the unincorporated territory of the United States, known as American Samoa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pago Pago

questions.question: Which of these celebrities is a fan of the Los Angeles Lakers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Is Conakry the capital of a country, formerly known as Portuguese Guinea?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: This city, famous for the Parthenon on the Acropolis, is the capital of Greece.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Athens
